amendments.summary: Landmark amendment: renamed 'Lunacy Ordinance' to 'Mental Diseases Ordinance'. Added Section 34 substituting 'insane criminal' with updated terminology. Endorsed 1956-02-17. Scanned PDF available from Parliament.lk.
amendments.details: Parliament.lk (G3157). This is the most significant amendment — it renamed the entire Ordinance from 'Lunacy' to 'Mental Diseases' and updated archaic terminology. Section 34 was added to substitute the term 'insane criminal' with less stigmatising language. The last amendment made to this Ordinance — no changes in 69 years since.

timeline.details: Enacted on 9 January 1873 as 'An Ordinance to make further and better provision relating to the care and custody of persons of unsound mind and their estates'. Established legal framework for admission, custody, and release of persons of unsound mind, and administration of their estates.

tiers.name: Minister
tiers.relationship: Regulatory authority: makes regulations under Section 15, authorises non-pauper admissions under Section 6

tiers.name: Director of Mental Health
tiers.relationship: Administrative head: manages mental hospitals, discharges temporary patients under Section 31

tiers.name: National Institute of Mental Health (NIMH)
tiers.relationship: Designated mental hospital at Angoda (established administratively, not by this Ordinance)

tiers.name: District Courts
tiers.relationship: Admission jurisdiction: receives applications for committal, conducts inquiries under Sections 2-4

currentReplacement.national: Ministry of Health — mental health policy; Director of Mental Health — operational oversight
currentReplacement.provincial: Not devolved — mental health governance remains a national function under this Ordinance
currentReplacement.regional: NIMH (Angoda) is the primary national mental hospital; regional mental health units exist in general hospitals
currentReplacement.local: District Courts retain admission jurisdiction under the Ordinance
